metadata.title: Pecal - All-in-One Workspace for Teams
metadata.description: Pecal is an all-in-one productivity platform that handles team collaboration, project management, and documentation in one place. Start free today.
metadata.ogDescription: Team collaboration, project management, and documentation in one place. Maximize productivity with Pecal.

hero.description: Team collaboration, project management, and documentation in one place. Maximize productivity with Pecal.
hero.noCreditCard: No credit card required · Free plan forever

download.title: Download Desktop App
download.description: Manage your work faster and more conveniently with the Pecal desktop app. Get an optimized native app experience.

platforms.macosArmDesc: For M1, M2, M3 chip Macs

features.title: Everything your team needs
features.description: From documentation to project management, all the features you need for team collaboration.

docs.title: Smart Documentation
docs.description: Create and share ideas quickly with AI-powered documentation. Collaborate in real-time with your team members.

project.title: Flexible Project Management
project.description: Manage projects with various views like Kanban, Timeline, and Calendar. Customize workflows to fit your team.

workspace.title: Unified Workspace
workspace.description: Documents, databases, and projects all connected. Manage scattered information in one place and search quickly.

ai.title: AI Assistant
ai.description: Automate repetitive tasks and discover insights. AI takes your team's productivity to the next level.

security.title: Enterprise Security
security.description: SOC 2 Type II certified, SSO, audit logs, and more enterprise-grade security. Your data is safely protected.

integrations.title: Endless Integrations
integrations.description: Connect with 200+ tools like Slack, GitHub, and Figma. Use Pecal while maintaining your existing workflow.

pricing.title: Simple pricing
pricing.description: Choose the plan that fits your team. Upgrade anytime.

enterprise.name: Enterprise
enterprise.description: Security and admin features for large organizations

cta.title: Get started today
cta.description: The first step to better team collaboration. Transform how you work with Pecal.

footer.description: All-in-one workspace for teams. Collaboration, docs, and projects unified.
footer.address: Address: 16-4 Takyeong-ro 15beon-gil, Buk-gu, Gwangju, Republic of Korea

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: yojung (the 'Company') values your privacy and complies with relevant laws including the Personal Information Protection Act. This Privacy Policy explains what personal information we collect, how we use it, how long we retain it, and how we dispose of it when you use our services.

section1.title: 1. Personal Information We Collect
section1.content: We collect the following personal information to provide our services.

required.title: a. Required Information
items: Email address
Nickname (username)
Social login information (Kakao account information)
Service usage records, IP address, cookies, access logs

optional.title: b. Optional Information
items: Profile image
Team information (team name, description)
Workspace information
Task and calendar information

section2.title: 2. Purpose of Collection and Use
section2.content: We use the collected personal information for the following purposes.
purposes: Membership registration and management: Member identification, identity verification, registration confirmation
Service provision: Task management, team collaboration, project management features
Service improvement: New service development, personalized services, statistical analysis
Customer support: Inquiry handling, notice delivery, complaint resolution
Marketing and advertising: Event information and participation opportunities (only with consent)

section3.title: 3. Retention and Use Period
section3.content: In principle, we destroy personal information without delay after the purpose of collection and use has been achieved.
retention: Member information: Until membership withdrawal (except when required by law)
Service usage records: 3 years (Protection of Communications Secrets Act)
Consumer complaint or dispute resolution records: 3 years (E-Commerce Act)
Payment and supply records: 5 years (E-Commerce Act)

section4.title: 4. Provision to Third Parties
section4.content: We do not provide personal information to third parties in principle. However, exceptions apply in the following cases.
exceptions: When users have given prior consent
When required by law or requested by investigative agencies following legal procedures
When necessary for service provision (e.g., providing to payment gateway for payment processing)

section5.title: 5. Outsourcing of Personal Information Processing
section5.content: We outsource personal information processing tasks to external companies as follows to improve our services.
section5.note: When entering into outsourcing contracts, we stipulate and supervise necessary matters to ensure that contractors handle personal information safely in accordance with the Personal Information Protection Act and related laws.

section6.title: 6. Rights of Users and Legal Representatives
section6.content: Users may exercise the following rights at any time.
rights: Request to stop processing personal information
section6.note: Rights can be exercised through the settings page or customer support, and we will take action without delay.

section7.title: 7. Installation and Operation of Automatic Collection Devices
section7.content: We operate 'cookies' that periodically store and retrieve user information.

cookie.what: A cookie is a small amount of information that a website sends to a user's browser.
cookie.purpose: Cookies are used for user convenience and to provide personalized services.
cookie.control: Users have the choice to accept cookies and can set cookie options through web browser settings to allow, block, or warn about cookies.

section8.title: 8. Security Measures
section8.content: In accordance with Article 29 of the Personal Information Protection Act, we take the following technical and administrative measures to ensure security.
measures: Personal information encryption: Passwords are encrypted for storage and management
Technical measures against hacking: Installation of firewalls, antivirus programs, etc.
Minimization and training of personal information handlers: Designation of personal information managers and regular training
Access control: Granting, changing, and revoking access rights to personal information processing systems

section9.title: 9. Privacy Officer
section9.content: We have designated a Privacy Officer who is responsible for overall personal information processing and handles complaints and remedies related to personal information processing.

contact.title: Privacy Officer
contact.name: Department: Pecal Operations Team
contact.note: For other reports or consultations regarding personal information infringement, please contact the following organizations.
agencies: Supreme Prosecutors' Office Cyber Investigation Department (www.spo.go.kr / 1301)
National Police Agency Cyber Safety Bureau (cyberbureau.police.go.kr / 182)

section10.title: 10. Changes to Privacy Policy
section10.content: This Privacy Policy is effective from the date of implementation, and if there are additions, deletions, or corrections due to changes in laws and policies, we will announce them through notices at least 7 days before the changes take effect.

termsOfService.title: Terms of Service
termsOfService.intro: These Terms of Service ('Terms') govern your use of the Pecal service ('Service') provided by yojung ('Company'), and establish the rights, obligations, and responsibilities between the Company and users.

section1.title: Article 1 (Purpose)
section1.content: These Terms aim to define the conditions and procedures for using the Pecal service provided by the Company, as well as the rights, obligations, and responsibilities between the Company and users.

section2.title: Article 2 (Definitions)
items: 'Service' refers to the Pecal workspace platform and all related services provided by the Company.
'User' refers to a member who uses the Service in accordance with these Terms.
'Member' refers to a person who has provided personal information to the Company and entered into a service agreement.
'Workspace' refers to an independent work area within the Service where users manage tasks, files, projects, etc.
'Content' refers to all information such as text, images, and files created or uploaded by users within the Service.

section3.title: Article 3 (Effectiveness and Amendment of Terms)
items: These Terms take effect when posted on the Service screen or otherwise notified to users.
The Company may amend these Terms within the scope not violating applicable laws, and will notify users at least 7 days before the effective date with the reason for amendment.
If a user does not agree to the amended Terms, they may stop using the Service and withdraw.
Continued use of the Service after the effective date of amended Terms shall be deemed as consent to the changes.

section4.title: Article 4 (Service Agreement)
items: The service agreement is established when the user agrees to these Terms and completes the registration process prescribed by the Company.
The Company supports easy registration through social login (Kakao, Google, etc.).

The Company may refuse registration or terminate the agreement in the following cases: using another person's information, providing false information, or otherwise interfering with service operations.

section5.title: Article 5 (Service Content)
section5.content: The services provided by the Company include the following.
items: Task management (create, edit, delete, status management)
Calendar-based schedule management
File upload and management
Team workspace and collaboration features
Personal and team storage management
Other services developed or provided through partnerships

section6.title: Article 6 (Service Modification and Suspension)
items: The Company may modify all or part of the Service for improvement purposes.
The Company may temporarily suspend the Service due to unavoidable circumstances such as natural disasters or system failures.
The Company will notify users in advance of any service modifications or suspensions. However, in urgent cases, notification may be provided afterward.

section7.title: Article 7 (User Obligations)
items: Users must comply with applicable laws and these Terms when using the Service.
Users must not collect, store, or disclose other people's personal information.
Users must not engage in illegal activities using the Service.
Users must not interfere with the stable operation of the Service.
Users are responsible for managing their account information.

section8.title: Article 8 (Paid Services and Payment)
items: The Company may provide paid services (plan subscriptions) in addition to free services.
Usage fees and payment methods for paid services are specified on the Service's information page.
Users must pay the applicable fees when using paid services.
Payment cancellation and refunds are subject to applicable laws and the Company's refund policy.
Upon subscription cancellation, the Service remains available until the current billing period expires, after which it converts to the free plan.

section9.title: Article 9 (Content Rights and Responsibilities)
items: Copyright of content created by users within the Service belongs to the respective users.
The Company may use user content for purposes of service operation, improvement, and promotion.
Users must not upload content that infringes on the intellectual property rights of others.
The Company may delete content that violates applicable laws or infringes on the rights of others without prior notice.

section10.title: Article 10 (Privacy Protection)
section10.content: The Company collects, uses, and manages users' personal information in accordance with its Privacy Policy. Please refer to the Privacy Policy for details.

section11.title: Article 11 (Disclaimer)
items: The Company is not liable for inability to provide the Service due to force majeure such as natural disasters, wars, or service suspension by telecommunications carriers.
The Company is not liable for service disruptions caused by the user's own fault.
The Company is not liable for any expected profits or losses users fail to achieve through the Service.
The Company has no obligation to intervene in disputes between users or between users and third parties arising through the Service, and is not liable for any resulting damages.

section12.title: Article 12 (Termination of Agreement)
items: Users may terminate the agreement (withdraw) at any time through the settings menu within the Service.
The Company may terminate the agreement after prior notice if a user violates these Terms. However, in urgent cases, notification may be provided afterward.
Upon termination, the user's personal information and content will be handled in accordance with the Privacy Policy.

section13.title: Article 13 (Dispute Resolution)
items: In case of disputes between the Company and users regarding the use of the Service, both parties shall negotiate in good faith for an amicable resolution.
If negotiation fails, the laws of the Republic of Korea shall govern, and jurisdiction shall be determined in accordance with the Civil Procedure Act.

section14.title: Supplementary Provisions
section14.content: These Terms take effect from February 12, 2026.
